page.title: 11THE RAMS OF SALISBURY PLAIN
page.content: In the ten acre Long Barrow field there was a flock of{fifty}rams. These were of two breeds, Suffolks and Dorsets, and each one will cover between 35 and 40 ewes during October and November, to lamb late March early April 1986. The rams are aged between 3 and 6 years. The Dorset breed produces lambs that mature early, of lighter weight, which should fetch a good price at the beginning of the season, while the Suffolk lambs mature much later, producing a heavier carcase. Hopefully these will also catch a good late market after the price has dipped and picked up again. Although the farm has reduced its ewe flock from 3,000 to 1,200 recently it is possibly the largest flock to be lambed under cover. Plenty of work for the shepherds as well as the rams!
